doc.str: The base Risc-V 32-bit integer instruction set. Based upon version 2.0.
The complete general-purpose register file. r0 always reads as 0.

Tertiary opcode field specifically used by shifts.
This is defined separately because its size is modified for RV64I.
Dummy instruction field used by the add operation for thread local storage.

20-bit immediate for U-type instructions.
The resulting register is sign-extended, but the field is treated as an unsigned value from a range-checking point of view.
Signed 20-bit immediate PC-relative field for U-type instructions.
5-bit immediate shift amount used for shift operations.

Four-argument version used for thread-local storage. The fourth argument is ignored; it's just used for a dummy relocation that associated the add instruction with the rest of the thread-local storage setup operation.
